medical_history.chief_complaint: Swelling in legs and general weakness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symmetric leg swelling began 4 weeks prior to presentation. Two weeks before presentation, the patient had difficulty wearing shoes due to swelling. Symptoms included progressive weakness, intermittent muscle aches, generalized fatigue, nausea, diffuse abdominal pain, and one episode of non-bloody, nonbilious vomiting. No chest pain, shortness of breath, or orthopnea reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of papillary thyroid cancer treated 11 years earlier with total thyroidectomy and radioiodine ablation. Diagnosed with hypertension and follicular non-Hodgkinâ€™s lymphoma 14 years ago, treated with chemotherapy and stem-cell transplantation 4 years prior. Mild chronic graft-versus-host disease managed with low-dose prednisone, which was discontinued 3 months before current presentation.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hypertension and coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with wife and two children in Massachusetts. Does not drink alcohol, has never smoked or used illicit drugs.
